intro: Calliandra leucothrix, commonly known as white calliandra, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences that produce clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets, and its stems are often woody and branched. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Calliandra leucothrix is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
